poem:
"The Altered Innocents"

So much depends
upon the brown trout
hooked on dream dust,
the starlings chirping
in relentless bliss,
the minnows dancing
a caffeinated jitterbug.

Behold the creations 
of human misuse,
wings and scales
surrendered to our
absent caution.

From sewage waters,
gleams a stark,
unnecessary truth:
we have too closely
shared our troubles
with the innocent
wilderness.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Meth-addict fish, aggro starlings, caffeinated minnows: animals radically changed by human drugs – study From brown trout becoming “addicted” to methamphetamine to European perch losing their fear of predators due to depression medication, scientists warn that modern pharmaceutical and illegal drug pollution is becoming a growing threat to wildlife. Drug exposure is causing significant, unexpected changes to some animals’ behaviour and anatomy. Female starlings dosed with antidepressants such as Prozac at concentrations found in sewage". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.

Drug exposure is causing significant, unexpected changes to some animals’ behaviour and anatomy. Female starlings dosed with antidepressants such as Prozac at concentrations found in sewage
